questions.question: What is the average magnetic course and distance between 60°00'N 020°00'W and Sumburgh VOR? (in the exam they gave an attached chart as an Annex - for revision practice use your Jeppesen Manual chart AT(H/L)1 or 5 AT(HI))
What is the average true track and distance between WTD NDB (52°11.3'N 007°05.0'W) and FOY NDB (52°34.0'N 009°11.7'W)? - use your Jeppesen E(LO)1
You are on a heading of 105°(C), deviation 3°E. WTD NDB (52°11.3'N 007°05.0'W) bears 013°(R), CRK VOR (51°50.4'N 008°29.7'W) QDM is 211°. What is your position? (Use Jeppesen E(LO)1)
The airport at 52°11'N 009°32'W is: (use Jeppesen E(LO)1)
Reference Jeppesen E(LO)1, position 52°11'N 009°31'W, which of the following denotes all the symbols?
What is the aircraft position in lat and long given the following (use Jeppesen chart E(LO)1): CRN (53°18'N 008°57'W) 18 DME, SHA (52°43'N 008°53'W) 20 DME, Heading 270°(M) Both ranges DME decreasing
What is the mean true track and distance from the BAL VOR (53°18'N 006°27'W) to CFN NDB (55°02'N 008°20'W)? - (use E(LO)1)
You are at position 53°40'N 008°00'W. What is the QDR from the SHA VOR (52°43'N 008°53'W)? - (use E(LO)1)
Your radial from the SHA VOR (52°43'N 008°53'W) is 120°(M). From the CRK VOR (51°51'N 008°30'W), the radial is 033°(M). What is your position? - (use E(LO)1)
QTE 'H' 326°(T) QTE 'G' 101°(T) Give the latitude and longitude of where the 2 position lines cross.
QTE 'G' 140°(T) QTE 'H' 270°(T) Give the latitude and longitude of where the 2 position lines cross.
DME 'L' 150 NM DME 'M' 150 NM Give the latitude and longitude of where the 2 position lines cross.
VOR 'I' QDR 339°(M) DME 'I' 120 NM Give the latitude and longitude of where the 2 position lines cross. Do not forget to apply variation to the VOR. Your DR position is 64°N 004°W.
RMI QDM NDB 'J' (in Norway) 120°(M) (Meridian Transfer) QTE 'H' 042°(T) Give the latitude and longitude of where the 2 position lines cross.
